div.p: STANCHION, or Stanchions, a fort of ſmall pillars of wood or iron uſed tor various purpoſes in a ship ; as to ſupport the decks, the quarter-rails, the nettings, the awnings, &c. The first of theſe are two ranges of ſmall columns fixed under the beams, throughout the ſhip’s length between decks ; one range being on the starboard and the other on the larboard side of the hatchways. They are chiefly intended to ſupport the weight of the artillery.
